intro: Diplochita angustiflora, commonly known as the narrow-leaved diplochita, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many economically important plants such as coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves and small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments within tropical forests. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for studies on plant morphology and ecological adaptation.
